channel.title: CyberNetSec - Patch Management
channel.description: Latest patch management threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: HPE Issues Urgent Patch for 10.0 CVSS RCE Flaw in OneView
item.description:
Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) has released an urgent security advisory for CVE-2025-37164, a critical vulnerability in its OneView infrastructure management software with a maximum CVSS score of 10.0. The flaw allows a remote, unauthenticated attacker to achieve complete remote code execution on ...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Industrial Control Systems

Read Full Article →

item.title: Actively Exploited RCE Flaw in WatchGuard Firewalls Puts Networks at Risk
item.description:
WatchGuard has issued an urgent advisory for customers to patch CVE-2025-14733, a critical remote code execution vulnerability in its Fireware OS that is confirmed to be under active exploitation. The flaw, an out-of-bounds write issue in the IKEv2 process, has a CVSS score of 9.3 and can be exploit...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: Active Attacks Exploit Critical Fortinet SSO Bypass Flaws to Gain Admin Access
item.description:
Security firm Arctic Wolf has observed active exploitation of two critical authentication bypass vulnerabilities in Fortinet products, CVE-2025-59718 and CVE-2025-59719. Both flaws, rated 9.1 in severity, allow an unauthenticated attacker to bypass FortiCloud single sign-on (SSO) by forging a SAML m...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: FreePBX Patches Critical Auth Bypass and RCE Flaws; Update VoIP Platforms Immediately
item.description:
The popular open-source VoIP platform FreePBX has been updated to fix several serious security vulnerabilities, including a critical authentication bypass (CVE-2025-66039) with a 9.3 CVSS score. This flaw, present in a non-default configuration, allows an attacker to bypass the admin login and poten...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Industrial Control Systems

Read Full Article →

item.title: CVSS 10.0: Atlassian Patches Critical RCE Flaw in Apache Tika Dependency
item.description:
Atlassian has issued security updates for a critical vulnerability, CVE-2025-66516, in the Apache Tika parser library, a third-party dependency used in many of its products. The flaw, which carries a perfect CVSS score of 10.0, is an XML External Entity (XXE) injection vulnerability. It can be explo...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: Apple Rushes iOS 26.2 Update to Patch Two Actively Exploited Zero-Days
item.description:
Apple has released an emergency security update, iOS 26.2 and iPadOS 26.2, to address 26 vulnerabilities. Among these are two critical zero-day flaws, CVE-2025-43529 and CVE-2025-14174, both residing in the WebKit browser engine. The company confirmed reports that these vulnerabilities have been act...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Mobile Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: CISA KEV Alert: Actively Exploited RCE Flaw in Sierra Wireless Routers
item.description:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has added a critical vulnerability in Sierra Wireless AirLink routers, CVE-2018-4063, to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog. The flaw, which has a CVSS score as high as 9.9, is an unrestricted file upload vulnerability t...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Industrial Control Systems

Read Full Article →

item.title: IBM Rolls Out Critical Patches for AIX, Cloud Pak, and Other Enterprise Software
item.description:
IBM has released a wave of security updates addressing vulnerabilities in numerous enterprise products, prompting an advisory from the Canadian Centre for Cyber Security. The bulletins, published between December 1 and December 7, 2025, include critical patches for IBM AIX, VIOS, Aspera Shares, Busi...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Patch Management, Vulnerability

Read Full Article →

item.title: Wireshark Vulnerabilities Create Denial-of-Service Risk for Security Teams
item.description:
France's national cybersecurity agency, CERT-FR, has issued a security advisory for two critical vulnerabilities in Wireshark, the world's most popular network protocol analyzer. The flaws, identified as CVE-2025-13945 and CVE-2025-13946, can be exploited by a remote attacker to cause a denial-of-se...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Security Operations

Read Full Article →

item.title: Cloudflare Outage Hits 28% of Global Traffic After Faulty React2Shell Patch
item.description:
Cloudflare, a leading internet infrastructure provider, experienced a 25-minute global outage on December 5, 2025, that impacted approximately 28% of its HTTP traffic and made numerous popular websites inaccessible. The company quickly confirmed the disruption was not a cyberattack but was self-infl...

Severity: High

Categories: Security Operations, Cyberattack, Patch Management

Read Full Article →
